ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how often did you feel like your surroundings were dreamlike, distant, or distorted?
Notes: 0 = None of the time; 1 = A little of the time; 2 = Some of the time; 3 = Most of the time; 4 = All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how often did you feel like you were outside of your body, watching yourself as if you were another person?
Notes: 0 = None of the time; 1 = A little of the time; 2 = Some of the time; 3 = Most of the time; 4 = All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how much pleasure would you have experienced if you spent leisure time with your friends?
Notes: 0 = No pleasure; 1 = A little; 2 = Some; 3 = A lot; 4 = Extreme pleasure

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how much pleasure would you have experienced if you spent time doing your favorite hobbies or pastimes?
Notes: 0 = No pleasure; 1 = A little; 2 = Some; 3 = A lot; 4 = Extreme pleasure

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how much pleasure would you have experienced if you spent quality time with the person or people closest to you?
Notes: 0 = No pleasure; 1 = A little; 2 = Some; 3 = A lot; 4 = Extreme pleasure

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how much pleasure would you have experienced if you had a big success at work, school, or in your finances?
Notes: 0 = No pleasure; 1 = A little; 2 = Some; 3 = A lot; 4 = Extreme pleasure

ElementDescription: Did you ever in your life have times lasting 3 months or longer when you had eating binges at least once a week; that is, your eating was out of control and you ate a very large amount of food over a short period of time (2 hours or less)?
About how many months in the past 12 did you have eating binges at least once a week?

BH4 = YES: Did you ever in your life have times lasting 3 months or longer when you made yourself vomit, took laxatives, or did other things to avoid gaining weight after binge eating?/ALL OTHERS: Did you ever in your life have times lasting 3 months or longer when you made yourself vomit, took laxatives, or did other things to avoid gaining weight?

BH4 = YES: About how many months in the past 12 did you make yourself vomit, take laxatives, or do other things to avoid gaining weight after binge eating?/ALL OTHERS: About how many months in the past 12 did you make yourself vomit, take laxatives, or do other things to avoid gaining weight?
Did a doctor or mental health professional ever diagnose you with schizophrenia or any other psychotic disorder?
Timepoint/visit label
Form used/assessment name
In the past 2 weeks, how many eating binges did you have where your eating was out of control and you ate a very large amount of food over a short period of time (2 hours or less)?
In the past 2 weeks, how many times did you make yourself vomit, take laxatives, or do other things to avoid gaining weight after binge eating?
